@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:4, topic:538109”]why are you using a while loop… those can cause deadlocks if used incorrectly.

you should be using some sort of task or event[/quote]

Yeah I changed it and I’m using a simple timer. I also figured out why it wouldn’t work, it just wouldn’t work with that interface.

item.title: PI - sendFrame126 countdown
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

I’m trying to have a countdown for a minigame. It counts down perfectly using “System.out.println” but when I try to write it using sendFrame126, it doesn’t work. The timer is supposed to countdown from 30 to 0, which it does, it just doesn’t show up in game.

My code:

public long time = System.currentTimeMillis();
public int num = 30;

public void runTime2() {
		while(num > 0) {
			if (System.currentTimeMillis() - time > 1000) {
				walkableInterface(11479);
				sendFrame126("Time: "+num+"", 11481);
				System.out.println(""+num);
				num--;
				time = System.currentTimeMillis();
			}
		}
	}

Read full topic
